section.p: An XSLT Parameter Set is a set of particular values of the XSLT stylesheet parameters that controls the view of a document in the Editing Window in the WYSIWYG mode.
XSLT Parameter Sets depend on the Document Type. Every stylesheet has at least the Default View parameter set - the values that are specified in the stylesheet itself.

You can do the following:
Switch between available XSLT Parameter Sets by changing the top-level XSLT parameters of the stylesheet in use.
For example, Docbook documents are rendered by default with gray boxes (draft areas) right below section titles that allow you to edit the section meta-information. You can switch off these boxes by changing the active XSLT parameter set:
On the toolbar, find a drop-down list with the inscription Default View.
Select the Clean set from this list to set the alternative XSLT Parameter Set which removes the draft areas.
Edit existing XSLT Parameter Sets.
Create new XSLT Parameter Sets.
